content.description: Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> activates gene expression only in cells exposed to a specific signaling molecule. In a study, researchers determined the intracellular location of Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in cultured cells both before and after exposing the cells to the signaling molecule. The results of the study are shown in the diagram.
content.question: Based on the results, which of the following best describes what Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is?

choices.label: Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is an <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> splicing enzyme.
Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a cell membrane receptor protein.
Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a transcription factor.

content.answer: Protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a transcription factor.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
